title: Alleged Unlawful Sensitive/Classified Technology Transfer at CalTech/JPL (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records pertaining to alleged espionage and/or violation(s) of the Arms Export Control Act and/or International Traffic in Arms Regulations at the California Institute of Technology and/or the Jet Propulsion Laboratory between 2010 and 2017, inclusive. The records I am requesting include, but are not limited to, alleged criminal conduct pertaining to the Electrospray Thruster Array Technology Feasibility Study, which was funded, in part, by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency.

In addition to a search of your agency's general and/or central indices I request that your agency also search: 1) Any "cross-referenced" records relevant to this inquiry; and, 2) "ELSUR" (Electronic Surveillance) records; and, 3) the Sentinel database; and, 4) the Investigative Data Warehouse; and, 5) the Data Integration and Visualization System.

This request is for any and all responsive records at all relevant FBI offices and facilities including, but not limited to, HQ and relevant field offices in Los Angeles County, California.

In order to facilitate the location of the requested records I am providing the following list of names that may be associated with these allegations and any related FBI investigation: Amir Gat, Sandra Troian, Daniel Weihs, Morteza Gharib, Kelly M. Sullivan, and, David Tsang.

Upon information and belief, Kelly M. Sullivan and David Tsang were FBI agents with the Los Angeles County Counterintelligence Division at the times relevant to this request. The personal names provided above should not be construed as a basis for limiting the scope of this records request.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a representative of the news media affiliated with the Randolph Bourne Institute and its media outlet, Antiwar.com. This request is made as part of news gathering and not for a commercial use.

I request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in my commercial interest. Specifically, this information will help advance public understanding of foreign intelligence activities targeted against the United States of America.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michelle Kinnucan

title: Request to DoD for 2022 budget of Community Engagement Office

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to DoD for 2022 budget of Community Engagement Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The annual budget report for the Department of Defense's Community Engagement Office, for the year 2022.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: New York FOIL Policies (Department of Health and Mental Hygiene)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Annual reports prepared by or for the agency that detail response times, compliance statistics, or other data related to the processing of public records requests. If quarterly or monthly reports are available, please also provide those. 

2. Statistical data or reports regarding the agency’s (a) average, (b) median, (c) shortest, and (d) longest processing times for public records requests for each year from January 1, 2020 to present.

3. Records showing the total number of public records requests pending as of the date of this request. If available, please include a breakdown of pending requests by duration (e.g., pending less than 30 days, 30–90 days, more than 90 days).

4. Policies, procedures, guidelines, memoranda, or training materials concerning how the agency determines or calculates the "statement of the approximate date, which shall be reasonable under the circumstances, when the request will be granted or denied," as required by Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a).

Requests 1, 2, and 4 are limited to records generated or in use on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Department of Defense support for TV series "Murder at the Motel"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for TV series "Murder at the Motel"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the TV series "Murder at the Motel" (2024-). Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Murder at the Motel," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Murder at the Motel" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Project Hail Mary," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

"Project Hail Mary" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: DoD Congressional Correspondence re: USS Liberty
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DoD Congressional Correspondence re: USS Liberty
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In the attached extract from the “Department of Defense Office of the Secretary of Defense Congressional Correspondence 2008 to 2011” there is a reference highlighted by a red rectangle.

We request all the correspondence and documents related to that reference.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Your Wyoming Department of Corrections public records request #25-247 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Wyoming Department of Corrections ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-247 has been submitted successfully. In compliance with the Wyoming Public Records Act, this letter is your 7 day response to your request for access to public records which was received by Wyoming Department of Corrections (WDOC) on the date listed in this response.  The WDOC is compiling and reviewing the records in response to your request. The WDOC must extend the response time of your request from seven (7) days to thirty (30) days due to the high volume of public record request we receive. Once prepared, fee payment is due if needed. You will be notified if any fees apply and any work that is completed that requires no charge will be provided.  Please do not hesitate to contact the WDOC through this system if we can be of further assistance. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Wyoming Department of Corrections.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

Wyoming Department of Corrections

communications.subject: Your New Mexico Corrections Department  public records request #25-343 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
New Mexico Corrections Department ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-343 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to the New Mexico Corrections Department. In order to thoroughly research whether we have records responsive to your request, we will respond as quickly as possible, but not later than 15 days from the time the request was received. However, should we discover that pursuant to the Inspection of Public Records Act (“IPRA”), NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, your request is excessively burdensome and broad, we may require additional time to respond, but will advise you prior to the end of this period. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact New Mexico Corrections Department .

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: New Jersey DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand
